attributes.action: Make Public Transport Strike Action Illegal - Put in Alternative Dispute Process
attributes.background: The Southern Trains series of strikes has left the paying commuter helpless with no resolution in sight. The status quo is not working and it is unfair for the public to suffer and be a pawn in these disputes. Strike action should be illegal and an alternative dispute method sought.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-38296623

attributes.action: Put restrictions on the amount of packaging used by British supermarkets.
attributes.background: In the light of the varied problems of climate change and waste disposal, it is inexcusable that supermarkets produce vast quantities of unnecessary packaging. Consumables, such as fruit and vegetables, confectionery and ready meals, do not need to be enclosed in multiple layers of plastic.
attributes.additional_details: Estimates put our annual levels of waste from packaging at around 5 mega-tonnes, this constitutes between a quarter and a third of our domestic waste. Responsibility for disposal and recycling of over-packaging should not be put on the consumer. Packaging to enclose goods such as bananas or tomatoes is entirely avoidable whilst for other products, such as confectionery, multiple layers of packaging are often used where one would suffice.

attributes.action: End the 'Special Relationship' with the USA in the event of a Trump presidency.
attributes.background: After 580,000 petitioned to ban his entry into the UK, Trump may become president. Our Special Relationship means the British people may be dragged into economic, political and military conflict by a hated man. In this time of vulnerability, the UK must distance itself from Trump's America.
attributes.additional_details: In a campaign mired in racism, xenophobia, extremism, and sexual assault, Donald Trump has outlined plans which, due to the US/UK 'Special Relationship', may endanger British citizens and interests. This includes nuclear proliferation in Korea and Japan, the abandonment of NATO, forcing Mexico to pay for a border wall, ground troops in Syria, torture, opposition to China, and potential war with Iran and North Korea. If Trump wins, the UK must take a stand against his administration.

attributes.action: Remove  Disabled Families/Parents/Children from the Troubled Families Policy
attributes.background:
We request that you fully support Disabled Families complete removal from this program.
Plus support a full public consultation to be launched to investigate. 
Why it was even deemed acceptable in the first place for Disabled Families inclusion in this policy.
attributes.additional_details:
Troubled Families Policy. 
As it stands the categories are: 
Parents and children involved in crime or anti-social behaviour 
Children who have not been attending school regularly 
Children who need help 
Adults out of work or at risk of financial exclusion and young people at risk of worklessness 
Families affected by domestic violence and abuse 
Parents and children with a range of health problems.

attributes.action: Investigate why there so many accidents on the M5 roadworks around Droitwich.
attributes.background: Since the roadworks were started between J6 and J4A and the lane restrictions were implemented, there have been almost daily incidents causing huge delays on this stretch of the M5. It's not as bad on similar motorway roadworks, so what's different about this stretch and what can be done about it?

attributes.action: Referendum for Universal Basic Income, paid monthly for UK working age citizens.
attributes.background: It is an income paid to individuals, as a right of legal residence, without means testing or requirements to work. The payment is non taxable and should be sufficient to cover basic needs. This would provide a secure floor for people to build on, rather than a means tested benefit.
attributes.additional_details:
All sourced from this website:

http://www.basicincome.org.uk/reasons-support-basic-income

attributes.action: stop the sale of The Royal Citadel Plymouth Devon
attributes.background: The government is going ahead with the sale of The royal Citadel in the next 10 years. It has been the home for thousands of commandos, who look at it as the home and a place to remember the fall comrades. Once again we feel that we are being let down by our MPS WHO WILL NEVER UNDERSTAND LOYALTY.

attributes.action: Introduce personal safety & criminal action awareness training in schools in UK
attributes.background: We are teachers & self defence instructors that work with children of all ages and last year we surveyed a number of pupils in secondary schools in South Yorkshire. 6/10 freely admitted that they had a fear of violence from other pupils. 4/10 pupils freely admitted being attacked in the community.
attributes.additional_details: violent Crime figures are rising year by year and from 2015-2016 grow by 27%. Our survey showed that the fear of physical violence, harassment or abuse was making 2/10 children severely depressed and had a dramatic effect on the learner of others. The fear of peer pressure and threats of violence had a dramatic effect on Girls taking part Physical education. Only 2/10 children surveyed said they would know or be confident in what to do to protect themselves against aggression or violence,

attributes.action: Change the name of the new GCSE's, as they are harder and worth more.
attributes.background: Recently GCSE's have been changed to make them more challenging for students. They have been made to prepare the students more for a levels, and we believe that this will be more challenging to get a good grade. The name 'GCSE' should be changed to something different.
attributes.additional_details:
Students now have to memorise there anthology (18 poems) in English.
Formulae have been removed from the Mathematics and Science GCSEs. So that must be memorised too.
Coursework has been replaced by full examinations. 
The content of the Mathematics GCSE has been expanded to cover A-Level topics.

attributes.action: Reduce school summer holidays for special needs students
attributes.background:
Children that suffer from autism etc find summer holidays a distressing upheaval to their usual routine. This can cause them to violently lash out. 
These children struggle after six weeks and find it very hard to settle back into a routine at school which is distressing for all those around.
attributes.additional_details: I am a mother of an autistic child.  I see the effect even just a week half term has on my son, so how does the government expect him to cope with 6 whole weeks?!  I am not the one parent that feels the holidays are far too long for these children. The government have been saying for years they will cut the archaic 6 week holidays yet they haven't made any adjustment.

attributes.action: Give everyone the right to see a GP within 48 hours of making an appointment
attributes.background: Many patients in the UK are waiting up to a month to get a routine GP appointment. This puts patients at risk, places an intolerable burden on A&E departments and undermines efforts at preventative healthcare. The government should set a target that everyone can see a GP within 48 hours of asking.

attributes.action: Make it easier to remove bullies from schools, at any age and fine the parents
attributes.background: As a parent, i find it outrageous that there is so much 'red tape' surrounding schools and exclusions. A child has to be excluded for a total of 45 DAYS before a permanent exclusion is warranted. Most of these exclusions are related to VERY SERIOUS incidents, but why wait for so many to take place?
attributes.additional_details: Parents whose children are victims of bullying are forced to remove their children from education for their safety, either to be home schooled or a change of school. Both of which can be extremely difficult for most. Why should victims have to change their friends, schools, routines and sometimes homes all because of bullies? It's time the bullies and their parents families faced the consequences of their childrens behaviour- not the other way round.

attributes.action: Preserve all existing rights of UK citizens to Freedom of Movement in the EU
attributes.background: The EU Referendum text did not instruct the Government to sign away UK citizens' current rights to travel, reside, work, study, or retire freely anywhere in the EU, without discrimination. Though on Brexit we lose EU citizenship, the Govt. has a duty to preserve our rights in its Brexit Agreement.
attributes.additional_details:
These Factsheets summarise your current rights of Free Movement 1) as EU citizens, & 2) via UK membership of the Single Market. You will lose these rights unless they are protected. 

1) Free Movement of Persons: (skip the Schengen section) http://www.europarl.europa.eu/atyourservice/en/displayFtu.html?ftuId=FTU_2.1.3.html 
2) Free Movement of Workers: (different emphasis: this is oriented to the Single Market): http://www.europarl.europa.eu/atyourservice/en/displayFtu.html?ftuId=FTU_3.1.3.html

attributes.action: Increase the maximum sentence for those found guilty of cruelty to a child
attributes.background: Innocence.The innocence of a baby or child should be cherished. But not all think that way. Some people see that innocence as their's to take. They neglect, ill-treat and assault. We've all read the stories, cried and screamed in disbelief at the sentences. It is time to do something about it.
attributes.additional_details: Cruelty to a child under the Children and Young Persons Act 1933 s.1 carries a maximum sentence of 10 years imprisonment. It includes a range of offences; neglect, abandonment, assault and cruelty, whether carried out once or numerous times. Children who this Act is meant to protect will never get their stolen innocence back and they get no justice with a maximum sentence of 10 years for those who stole it. The maximum sentence for those found guilty of child cruelty needs to be increased.

attributes.action: Save the NHS by creating a new law to commit 11% of U.K. GDP on Healthcare
attributes.background:
The NHS is in difficulties. With a growing ageing population we need a strong healthcare system. The U.K. Spends less as a proportion of GDP than many other neighbouring countries. 
Let's stop political parties using the NHS as a political tool. Let's all agree to spend 11% of  GDP  regardless.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.kingsfund.org.uk/projects/nhs-in-a-nutshell/health-care-spending-com

attributes.action: Ban the use of quad bikes dirt bikes on all public roads.
attributes.background: Dirt bikes & quad bikes are becoming a real nuisance on public roads & public parks all over the U.K. The police are unable to do anything. This needs to be stopped now before someone gets seriously hurt.

attributes.action: Better pay for support workers and carers they are the backbone of this country.
attributes.background: Carers, supported living and especially nursing homes, are the backbone of this country. Right now, the care sector and social welfare sector is suffering to the point of collapse. It is the backbone of this country. In order to attract a quality of care, the rate of pay MUST be increased.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/social-care-network/2015/jan/20/care-workers-better-pay-conditions

This article in the guardian more or less sums up the whole situation. 

If we are to attract a quality of staff that is prepared to actually "care" then we must give those staff the incentive to come and do so. Right now, the wage is slow low it is almost in design to attract abuse, negativity and bad care. And those who do care are pushed to their limit financially and emotionally. This must change.

attributes.action: Consider making the state visit of Donald Trump as grand as possible.
attributes.background: Donald Trump has clearly stated that he wants to build on the special relationship between the US and UK, which is one of the great forces in history for justice and peace. Our countries share a deep bond military, financial, cultural and political. We should make this the grandest state visit ever.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.standard.co.uk/news/politics/donald-trump-hails-usuk-special-relationship-as-he-welcomes-theresa-may-to-the-white-house-a3452096.html

attributes.action: Make all take-away and fast food outlets use compostable containers and cutlery.
attributes.background: I was inspired by the same ethos used at Glastonbury festival where all cutlery is wooden and the containers are made from expanded or blown cardboard, even when serving gravy. It will aid the recycling of food waste. We need to reduce the volume of plastics going to landfill.

attributes.action: Urge India to end abuse Human Rights abuse and initiate a peaceful dialogue
attributes.background:
Recent use of pellet guns on Kashmiri protestors has caused blindness of more than 150 people mostly children and 60 deaths.
Kashmir is under curfew and serious restrictions imposed on normal daily life for 45 days.
Indian refuses to initiate a dialogue
attributes.additional_details:
1. Sir Henry Harding, Governor General on behalf of the British sold Kashmir in 1846 to the Maharaja of Punjab Gulab Singh for 7,500,000 Indian Rupees who then gave it away as a dowry to his son in law Maharaja Hari Singh!
2. British citizensof Kashmiri origin have relatives, near and dear one suffering from the atrocities
3. Kashmir issue is the main flash point between the two nuclear powers, India and Pakistan. Violence only breads violence and plays in the hands of foreign agencies.

attributes.action: Involve the British public in the fight against climate change
attributes.background: Our collective CO2 emissions are just those of each individual added together: each of us can and must limit our carbon footprint. As well as strong legislative action, the government should contact every home to explain the reality and danger of climate change and advise what each of us should do.
attributes.additional_details:
The WHO: "Climate change is among the greatest health risks of the 21st century." Personal actions should be prioritised by relative impact. Former DECC Chief Scientific Advisor Sir David MacKay urged these steps, among others:
Stop (or dramatically reduce) flying
Replace driving with public transport, cycling or walking
Reduce the energy needed to make products we buy (frequent new electronics & clothing, packaging)
Eat vegetarian 6/7 days
Turn heating to 15-17 degrees
Increase home insulation.

attributes.action: Replace House of Lords with an elected house with advisory functions only.
attributes.background: The newly elected house would consist of a total of 100 representatives holding elections at the same time as a general election.  This would make the second house fully accountable to the electorate.  This would prevent the second house from subverting the will of the UK electorate.

attributes.action: A Law to give temp shelter to all rough sleepers if temps are predicted at Zero.
attributes.background:
Put a Law in place, that forces local authorities to give shelter to all rough sleepers should temperatures be predicted at below zero. 
Just today, this guy died on our streets, make it stop
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/tragedy-unknown-homeless-man-found-9372526?ICID=FB_mirror_main
attributes.additional_details:
Every year these guys face all weather conditions, and it is not acceptable by any means, there should be a law placed that these guys know that should the weather drop to zero they will be allocated some shelter, should they want it. 
Each local authority should be forced to allocate shelter by the Government, and I ask that a law be put in place to protect those in this difficult situation.

attributes.action: Link a dog owners national Insurance number to microchip details.
attributes.background: I have owned dogs for over 25 years. I am passionate about rescues and the hard work they do to ensure a dogs welfare. I am livid! That animal abuse is not taken more seriously in this country. Animal abusers should be put on a list.
attributes.additional_details: The amount of animal abuse videos I see the amount of dogs in rescues who struggle to make ends meet could be lowered. Micro chipping is law now in this country for dogs. Why can we not pass a law that states that when you get a dog you have to attach your national insurance number to said dog?? If you sell this dog rehome or put no rescue or even dump and you do not change NI details any costs incurred should be billed to the last NI on record, this way any costs made could be received back.

attributes.action: Strip Thameslink franchise, bringing back a British Rail government run service
attributes.background: Thameslink have failed for years. Customer satisfaction is low and journeys unsafe and infrequent. We need a train service fit and reliable for the needs of London and UK economy. Strip Thameslink of franchise, stop blaming years of under funding and bring back British Rail government run trains.
attributes.additional_details: This petition demands the return of government run franchise not having profits put before customer levels of safety and satisfaction. Bring back a British Rail system for failing train companies and hold them accountable in the way failing NHS or schools are supported and improved. Make UK mirror London and open for business 24hrs

attributes.action: Have a vote of no confidence in the Lord Chancellor
attributes.background: Liz Truss's response to the attacks in the press on the Law Lords is completely inadequate: she doesn't condemn them for saying the ruling was politically motivated but she does refer to the government's intention to appeal to the Supreme Court. She should speak for the judiciary, not the government

attributes.action: Call a referendum on the UK remaining in the European Economic Area (EEA).
attributes.background: The UK referendum rejected membership of the EU but voters were unable to express a preference for remaining in the European Economic Area (EEA - the Single Market). The most logical and democratic way to resolve this question is to have a new referendum with a new question.
attributes.additional_details: The EEA is the single market - it is Europe without Federalist aspirations. It allows the UK to trade freely with the EU. The UK is a signatory of this agreement and the "presumption of continuity" allows the UK to remain within the EEA if we so choose; there is no mechanism to eject us. The result of the EU referendum has been distorted and misinterpreted. The only thing we can conclude is that voters did not want to be part of the EU; EEA membership was not voted on.

attributes.action:
Bring out Identity Cards that hold DNA
details for EVERYONE living/enters UK
attributes.background: it's time to get a world wide data base, starting with the UK. everyone either Born/living/entering the uk should have to submit their DNA & then receive a Biometric ID card a cross between a bank card & a driving licence type. the results of less police hours would out weigh the cost of the cards.
attributes.additional_details:
not only would they cut down police hours saving the force money, they would free up officers to do deal with more crimes. as well as tracking down rapists and killers (where DNA was found) a lot quicker they would also help family's that have lost loved ones due to horrific circumstances,
i,e where a body is either badly composed or mutilated, the police could check DNA database and say ok this is them meaning that the family will not have a life time of a horrific image of their loved ones.

attributes.action: Make HCAs/phlebotomists belong to a professional registered body.
attributes.background: I am a healthcare assistant and a phlebotomist. I started off as a HCA over 4 years ago with no experience. I think that was dangerous. Especially with the care HCAs need to give. Would be nice for all the hard work we learn as we progress, and the care we give, that we belong to a recognised body.

attributes.action: Enforce taxi companies to charge accessible taxis the same as inaccessible ones
attributes.background:
A disabled person can end up paying 3 or 4 times more for a taxi journey compared to a non-disabled person. 
The same journey in an accessible taxi was £13.50 whereas friends in an inaccessible taxi were only charged £4.50.
attributes.additional_details:
It is unfair to charge a disabled person more for the same journey because they are disabled. 
Having a disability is already expensive, adding another cost to someone purely because they require a wheelchair (or other mobility aides) is discriminatory. 
The Equality Act 2010 Section 15 states that a person cannot be treated unfavourably because of their disability. 
Therefore I call on the government to change legislation so that disabled people aren't charged more due to their disability.

attributes.action: Article 50 should not be implemented without a debate and vote in parliament.
attributes.background: Implementing The Lisbon Treaty Article 50 will be one of the most important decisions that Britain has made for many years as there will be no going back.  It should not be left to the Executive to make this decision without recourse to parliament for debate and ratification by a vote of all MPs.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/brexit-eu-referendum-leave-article-50-lisbon-treaty-a7100436.html

attributes.action: Create and support a Women in Engineering Charter
attributes.background: Theresa May recently celebrated the Women in Finance Charter to tackle gender inequality. The lack of STEM capability in the UK is becoming a crisis, we need to take action to ensure there are opportunities for all. We need a diverse industry to provide infrastructure and services for a diverse UK!
attributes.additional_details:
This is the Women in Finance Charter: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/women-in-finance-charter

Lets replicate this for the engineering, including technology, sector.

attributes.action: Create a law that new buildings must have roofs covered in solar panels/plants.
attributes.background: Partially covering roofs with solar panels would help to reduce the building's carbon footprint. The plants would be used on roofs which don't face south. The plants would produce oxygen and also reduce the amount of energy needed to heat or cool a building and also create a place for birds to nest.
attributes.additional_details:
Similar laws have been put in place in San Fransisco and France. It is more cost effective to do this on new buildings than retrofit existing buildings.
For more information:
https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/mar/20/france-decrees-new-rooftops-must-be-covered-in-plants-or-solar-panels

https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2016/apr/21/san-francisco-adopts-law-requiring-solar-panels-on-all-new-buildings

attributes.action: Support workers/health care assistants to be paid a min of £10 per hour.
attributes.background: I work as a senior support worker on a dementia unit.  My responsibilities are vast in safeguarding vulnerable people. Most support staff working in the care sector will tell you how demanding the job role is. A true reflection of hourly pay is needed for what our job role involves.

attributes.action: Stop county councils from increasing council tax by more than annual inflation.
attributes.background: Surrey County Council have recently stated that they are proposing a 15% increase in council tax, when the current annual inflation rate at December 2016 is only around 2%. It is not fair or affordable for the public to pay so much more than the rate of inflation due to the council's inefficiencies.
attributes.additional_details:
Articles in local Surrey Mirror press:

19/1/2017: http://www.surreymirror.co.uk/surrey-county-council-announces-plans-for-15-per-cent-council-tax-hike/story-30070982-detail/story.html

23/12/2016: http://www.surreymirror.co.uk/cash-strapped-surrey-county-council-refuses-to-rule-out-eye-watering-200-rise-in-council-tax/story-30006252-detail/story.html?f8g6fa

attributes.action: Subsidise train fares for 16-18 year olds in full-time education
attributes.background: My 2 sons best mode of transport to School is the train.We just paid £191 for my 15 year old for this term(6wks) and my 16yr old £382 for the same journey just because he turned 16!!He is still in the same school.16 -18 year olds in full time education should not be paying adult fares
attributes.additional_details: I challenged GWR( the rail company in this instance but other tail companies are also guilty) and I was told that there is a 16 - 25 year old 1/3rd off discount card which sounded brilliant except you can't activate it before 10am or you pay £12 flat day rate which works out more expensive than an adult season ticket.The 1/3rd discount card is a fraud as it does not do what it says!!. What 16 - to 25 year old goes anywhere meaningful daily after 10am? Students and workers take earlier trains.

attributes.action: Make the Sure Start Maternity Grant Equal to ALL babies!
attributes.background: When having a baby, you're entitled to apply for a Sure Start Maternity Grant.  However if you/partner dont receive benefits you are immediately singled out and unable to claim, therefore stating just because you earn a living you baby does not have the right to an equal £500.00 kick start to life!

attributes.action: People who work in ALL places of Worship must be DBS and OFSTED checked
attributes.background: I was abused by the Imam at the mosque I attended in the 1980s. I went to court, attended trials and finally got the guilty verdict.  He was sentenced to 11 and half years but absconded the next day. I’m waiting for him to be extradited back. I wrote a book in 2012 about my story, called “Brutal”.
attributes.additional_details:
Brutal By Nabila Sharma 2012
Hafiz Rahman sentenced to 11 and half years at Wolverhampton Crown Court October 2016.

attributes.action: Additional Law for Police to seize stationary Uninsured/Unregistered vehicles
attributes.background: Currently Police don't have the power to seize vehicles that are parked unattended and uninsured on our roads under S.165 Road Traffic Act 1988 if its taxed etc. A huge problem is criminals buying these cars, not being the registered owner therefore evading possible penalties incurred.
attributes.additional_details:
A REGISTERED vehicle which has INSURANCE will be traceable when it comes to NtO (Fines) etc... 
But if Un-registered / Un-Insured = No parking fines, No speeding fines EVER and driver/owner untraceable to authorities unless they are caught in the act with the vehicle. I petition to enforce a power for police to seize any vehicle on a public road that is not lawfully insured regardless if the owner has been caught driving it or not.
We must be Proactive and not Reactive in crime prevention!

attributes.action: Make chrons disease a disability
attributes.background: Its hard to get out most days as when you have this disease you are constantly on the toilet.You cant even get out of bed most days your belly hurts that much it feels like you are in labour 24/7 please help us we all look fine on the outside but feel so bad on the inside.

attributes.action: Raise the issue of the Taiji Dolphin slaughters with the Japanese Government
attributes.background: I've been horrified to learn & witness that every year in Taiji,Japan, dolphins are chased into a small cover and butchered in the most horrific and cruel way imaginable. The hunts are subsidized by the dolphin captivity industry,for a few "show quality' dolphins that are ripped from their families.
attributes.additional_details: People across the world have been shocked by this act of cruelty that is live streamed by many welfare organisation to raise awareness, e.g. dolphin project, sea shepherd,racing against extinction etc. This year the order book for Taiji is 150 dolphins for captivity, anymore captured will be killed. The world is watching and speaking out against Taiji but Governments continue to ignore their people. We ask, when will someone in power step forward and end this horrific act before its too late.

attributes.action: Allow 16 year olds to vote in Northern Ireland election
attributes.background: After the collapsing of the devolved government in Northern Ireland, it is so important that young people are able to have a say. Yet those who are under 18 still have no voice in our future. 16 year olds were allowed to vote in the Scottish Referendum, so why not the youth of Northern Ireland?
attributes.additional_details: This year marks the 19th anniversary of the Good Friday Agreement, when peace was brought between the Nationalist and Unionist sides in Northern Ireland. Yet for many young people, they are now receiving their first at a time when our politics is in turmoil following the RHI scandal and the breakdown between power-sharing Sinn Fein and DUP. The only way to change this is by giving young people the chance to have their voice heard and move on once and for all for a better future!

attributes.action: Make Christmas Day & Boxing Day family time not business time
attributes.background: We should go back 14 years ago when christmas day and boxing day when everything was closed and all family spent time together. These days it's about business and who can make more money. Not family time whats so ever. I've got son nearly two years old but have to spend christmas day at work.
attributes.additional_details:
Every one using this two days for a business does not care about families with small children, old people.

At least from 365 days these two days everything should be closed.

attributes.action: End all government subsides and other financial aid to the fossil fuel industry.
attributes.background: The UK government provides the domestic fossil fuel industry with funds to the tune of £6 billion annually. This industry, endangering all of us by intensifying climate change, is getting money from our government at the expense of the taxpayer. This has to stop before it is too late.
attributes.additional_details:
Direct subsides are hard to calculate –  Reasonable mid-range figure is £6 billion annually, given by widely trusted sources such as the Independent and the Overseas Development Institute(ODI) however the UK claims not to have any using an irrational definition. The International Monetary Fund puts the figure much higher at £26b.
This petition's specific demand is that fossil fuel subsides, as defined by the ODI are to be abolished by 2020 and the extra revenue should be invested in clean energy.

attributes.action: Video all pip and esa assessments
attributes.background: There seems to be so many stories that atos, capita and other assessment companies are causing benefits to be stopped because of their lies... if they are video recorded then each party is completely backed up

attributes.action: Make thieves liable for their victims insurance for a set amount of time
attributes.background:
I and thousands of people across the country have been victims of theft, be it vehicle, home or personal theft. 

A lot of us feel that the justice system is not helping the victim. We fear going through our insurance company as it affects us by increasing our insurance premium.
attributes.additional_details: There are thousands of car, motorcycle and home thefts throughout the year, admittedly not all the culprits are found, but those that are, and are found guilty in our opinion get away lightly, a fine, a suspended sentence. This doesn't really help the victim who could be put out of pocket by losing their no claims bonus on insurance therefore hitting their pockets again. I would like to make it so all criminals found guilty are liable to pay the victims insurance for a set amount of time.

attributes.action: Call on UK government to stop dealing immediately with Sudan Government
attributes.background: Based on testimony from caregivers and survivors, Amnesty International estimates that more than 200 people may have died as a result of exposure to the chemical weapons agents, with many being children.The majority of survivors of the chemical weapons attacks have had no access to medical care.
attributes.additional_details:
An Amnesty International investigation has gathered horrific evidence of the repeated use of what are believed to be chemical weapons against civilians, including very young children, by Sudanese government forces in one of the most remote regions of Darfur over the past eight months.
Please take an action to end this aggression and dangerous crimes of Sudan Government.

https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2016/09/sudan-credible-evidence-chemical-weapons-darfur-revealed/

attributes.action: I wish the Home Office to review the case of a Fijian soldier Semesa Maiyale.
attributes.background: Semesa Maiyale known as Sam joined the British army in 2003 and served with the Kings Own Scottish Borders and then the Royal Regiment of Scotand serving nine years,completed tours of Iraq and was promised the right to remain in the Uk after his service ended.
attributes.additional_details: Sam was discharged in 2012, Sam has no right to work, cannot claim benefits or housing and is supported by his partner who as a staff nurse is having to provide for the both of them and their son. sam rightly feels betrayed and let down.

attributes.action: We want a General Election before the Government initiates Article 50.
attributes.background:
We agree to the PM’s appeal that we should all ‘come together’ after all, we are supposed to be the UK and not a divisive little England, Wales, Scotland or Northern Ireland.

We have been fed with lies, and propaganda by various parties and media. It is time to get our country’s act together!
attributes.additional_details: Whether it was the result of the PM and her government or not, it is obvious that the country is suffering from, NHS chaos; the fluctuating value of the £ Sterling; the increase in ‘borrowed’ public money; increasing racial ill-feeling against foreign EU workers & immigrants; increasing import costs (particularly food and fuel); strikes & increases of public transport and the public fears & confusion of our future. We need a genuine majority for an election & not a first past the post system.

attributes.action: Make the Work Capability Assessment illnesss specific
attributes.background: The Work Capability Assessments for the past five years have been heavily directed towards physical disability which is irrelevant to those suffering from mental illnesses. This makes it almost impossible for anybody with a mental illness to be assessed accordingly.
attributes.additional_details: Examples of the assessments carried out for all claimants, regardless of their condition, be it mental or physical include: reaching, standing and sitting, absence or loss of control of the bowel, consciousness during waking moments and picking up or moving and transferring. This is part of a long list of many assessments which do not relate to mental illness. This has meant that people with mental health problems, signed off work by a doctor and or psychiatrist are often declared fit for work, resulting in a decline in their health and often suicide. We ask that the assessments are specific to the disability of the claimant in order to obtain a fair assessment of that individual's disability.
